result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Franklin Vincent Masterson

records.addlTxt: Signed by EFV on 11/1/22. arc      c: SCSO with Certified copy
to transport. Filed by DA Office. arc   to EFV
22R 014759.   Posted DE. olg

** AMENDED ** 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, T.H.. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

3:32 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Franklin Vincent Masterson.  Defendant Franklin Vincent Masterson in court, in custody. Court reviews case. Atty Satorius states DE is no longer on a PO Hold and request bond modification. Court sets PH. Atty Satorius makes bond argument and Defendant has a bed date for January for Treatment. Court Amends bond. Court finds good cause to go beyond prelim time limits. Adjourned 03:37 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Filed by Atty Satorius. arc    e: DA

01:09 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court. Defendant Franklin Vincent Masterson appeared by video from Pierce County Jail.  Unknown if DE qualifies. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Bond argument. Court orders bond. DE is on PO Hold in Pierce County. Clerk to mail bond to DE in Pierce County. Court sets STC. Adjourned 01:17 PM
